content:
## MARKET OVERVIEW

1. What is the Current Market Regime?
RISK-ON environment: low volatility at 21.4% and mixed breadth (4/8 sectors positive). Market favors beta and cyclicals but participation is moderate, so rallies need confirming follow-through.

2. Which sectors are leading?
Technology & Telecom and Transportation are leading: KONTR (1W: +5.20% | 1M: -0.39%) RECOVERY, THYAO (1W: +4.47% | 1M: +14.24%) ABOVE TREND. Retail & Food shows broad strength with BIMAS (1W: +2.19% | 1M: +12.84%) ABOVE TREND.

3. Which sectors are lagging?
Banking & Finance and Holding & Investment are lagging on the week with profit-taking: GARAN (1W: -5.94% | 1M: +6.59%) CORRECTION, SAHOL (1W: -5.73% | 1M: +11.28%) CORRECTION. Energy & Chemicals is mixed with sharp winners and big laggards: TUPRS (1W: -8.38% | 1M: +5.62%) CORRECTION.

## STOCK PERFORMANCE

4. Top Performing Stocks?
TRALT (1W: +6.24% | 1M: +11.61%) ABOVE TREND, KONTR (1W: +5.20% | 1M: -0.39%) RECOVERY, TKFEN (1W: +4.49% | 1M: +15.66%) ABOVE TREND, THYAO (1W: +4.47% | 1M: +14.24%) ABOVE TREND, ARCLK (1W: +4.06% | 1M: +12.12%) ABOVE TREND.

5. Worst Performing Stocks?
TUPRS (1W: -8.38% | 1M: +5.62%) CORRECTION, EKGYO (1W: -7.09% | 1M: +11.99%) CORRECTION, GARAN (1W: -5.94% | 1M: +6.59%) CORRECTION, SAHOL (1W: -5.73% | 1M: +11.28%) CORRECTION, AKBNK (1W: -5.00% | 1M: +13.67%) CORRECTION.

6. Momentum Stocks?
TRALT (1W: +6.24% | 1M: +11.61%) ABOVE TREND, KONTR (1W: +5.20% | 1M: -0.39%) RECOVERY, TKFEN (1W: +4.49% | 1M: +15.66%) ABOVE TREND, THYAO (1W: +4.47% | 1M: +14.24%) ABOVE TREND, TUPRS (1W: -8.38% | 1M: +5.62%) CORRECTION.

## SECTOR OUTLOOK

7. Banking Sector Outlook?
Banks are under short-term pressure after a pullback despite healthy 1M gains; AKBNK (1W: -5.00% | 1M: +13.67%) CORRECTION, GARAN (1W: -5.94% | 1M: +6.59%) CORRECTION, ISCTR (1W: -3.04% | 1M: +17.16%) CORRECTION — watch relative strength in HALKB (1W: +2.85% | 1M: +12.57%) ABOVE TREND for rotation signals.

8. Industrial Sector Outlook?
Heavy industry shows constructive breadth: EREGL (1W: +1.53% | 1M: +17.36%) ABOVE TREND, ARCLK (1W: +4.06% | 1M: +12.12%) ABOVE TREND, while autos show mixed pullbacks—TOASO (1W: -3.77% | 1M: +11.60%) CORRECTION, FROTO (1W: -0.52% | 1M: +17.31%) CORRECTION.

9. Energy & Chemicals Outlook?
Energy is bifurcated: TRALT (1W: +6.24% | 1M: +11.61%) ABOVE TREND, PETKM (1W: +2.94% | 1M: +11.49%) ABOVE TREND and GUBRF (1W: +2.67% | 1M: +36.08%) ABOVE TREND versus TUPRS (1W: -8.38% | 1M: +5.62%) CORRECTION and OYAKC (1W: -3.91% | 1M: +5.60%) CORRECTION — earnings, margins and oil moves are key.

## PORTFOLIO STRATEGY

10. Portfolio Recommendation?
Modestly overweight cyclicals and high-quant retail/industrial names while trimming consensus bank and holding exposure; keep size discipline as participation is moderate and rallies need follow-through. Use TUPRS and bank pullbacks as selective buy-on-weakness setups, but favor names with confirmed ABOVE TREND momentum.

## NEXT WEEK OUTLOOK

11. Stocks to Watch Next Week?
THYAO (1W: +4.47% | 1M: +14.24%) ABOVE TREND for travel recovery flow, TRALT (1W: +6.24% | 1M: +11.61%) ABOVE TREND for energy momentum, TUPRS (1W: -8.38% | 1M: +5.62%) CORRECTION for mean-reversion, AKBNK (1W: -5.00% | 1M: +13.67%) CORRECTION for bank sentiment, KONTR (1W: +5.20% | 1M: -0.39%) RECOVERY for tech rotation.

12. Sectors to Watch Next Week?
Retail & Food for defensive consumption strength and high quant scores, Energy & Chemicals for volatility-driven opportunities, and Banking for directional confirmation after the weekly pullback.

13. Key Levels & Triggers?
Monitor XU100 reaction to last week's high and low: a sustained break above the 1-month high would confirm continuation of the risk-on move, while a decisive break below last week's low would shift flows into risk-off. Watch oil prices, global risk sentiment and local liquidity/cb communications as primary catalysts.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
Low-volatility RISK-ON market with mixed breadth; cyclical names in tech, transport and retail are leading while banks and holdings lag after profit-taking. Opportunity exists to add momentum leaders (TRALT, THYAO, TKFEN) and selectively buy corrections in TUPRS and large banks if macro catalysts align, but keep stops tight given moderate participation.
